meanings.sent1: The pressure built up in the bottle until it couldn't hold it anymore and started spuing out.
meanings.sent2: The volcano spued hot lava and ash into the sky.
meanings.sent3: The water gun unexpectedly started spuing water all over the backyard.
meanings.sent4: The burst pipe spuing water resembled a fountain in the middle of the street.
meanings.sent5: The shaken soda can spuing its contents made a fizzy mess on the floor.

meanings.sent1: After eating too much candy, he felt sick and ended up spuing in the bathroom.
meanings.sent2: The cat spued a hairball on the carpet.
meanings.sent3: The motion sickness caused her to spue during the turbulent plane ride.
meanings.sent4: The upset stomach made him spue his dinner into the trash can.
meanings.sent5: The smell of the garbage made her spue uncontrollably.

meanings.definition: To flow or gush out rapidly
meanings.sent1: The burst dam caused water to spue down the valley, flooding everything in its path.
meanings.sent2: The burst water pipe spued water all over the basement floor.
meanings.sent3: The overflowing river spuing over its banks created a dangerous situation for the nearby town.
meanings.sent4: The burst balloon spuing confetti added a festive touch to the party.
meanings.sent5: The broken fire hydrant spuing water created a temporary fountain on the street.
